com.bumptech.glide.presenter
Class ImagePresenter<T>

java.lang.Object
  com.bumptech.glide.presenter.ImagePresenter<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of the model that contains information necessary to display an image. Can be as simple as a String containing a path or a complex data type.
public class ImagePresenter<T>
extends java.lang.Object

Wraps an Target to display arbitrary Bitmaps and provides a framework for fetching and loading bitmaps correctly when targest are being recycled. Uses ModelLoader to between a model StreamLoader for a given model, a StreamLoader to download or otherwise obtain an InputStream for a given model, and an ImageLoader to load a bitmap from a given InputStream. This class also determines the width and height of the wrapped ImageView at runtime and passes that information to the provided ModelLoader and ImageLoader.

Nested Class Summary

static interface ImagePresenter.ImageReadyCallback<T>
          A callback interface used to perform some action when an ImagePresenter sets a new bitmap in an ImageView

Constructor Detail

ImagePresenter

protected ImagePresenter(ImagePresenter.Builder<T> builder)
Method Detail

setModel

public void setModel(T model)
Sets a model to load an image from. Each subsequent call will override all previous calls and will prevent any bitmaps that are loaded from previous calls from being displayed even if the load completes successfully. Any image being displayed at the time of this call will be replaced either by the placeholder or by the new image if the load completes synchronously (ie it was in an in memory cache)

Note - A load will not begin before the ImagePresenter has determined the width and height of the wrapped view, which can't happen until that view has been made visible and undergone layout for the first time. Until then the current load is stored. Subsequent calls will replace the stored load.

Parameters:
model - The model containing the information required to load a path and/or bitmap

resetPlaceHolder

public void resetPlaceHolder()
Sets the placeholder as the current image for the ImageView. Does not cancel any previous loads, so the placeholder could be replaced with a loaded bitmap at any time. To cancel a load and display a placeholder call clear().

clear

public void clear()
Prevents any bitmaps being loaded from previous calls to setModel from being displayed and clears this presenter's ImageLoader and this presenter's ModelLoader. Also displays the current placeholder if one is set

isImageSet

protected boolean isImageSet()
For use primarily with ImagePresenter.ImagePresenterCoordinator

Returns:
True iff the wrapped ImageView is displaying an image loaded by this ImagePresenter. False if the wrapped ImageView is displaying a placeholder set by this presenter.
